page.title: 07HOLCOMBE FARM(continued)
page.content: the barley goes for malting, to make beer;the corn goes for testing. The poorer quality is used to make cattlecake. A typical day for the farmer begins by feeding the animals, and making sure they have enough water. The routine also depends on the weather. In Winter the animals are in sheds, and if the water is frozen it has to be carted to them.In Spring there is ploughing to be done during the day, but Summer and Autumn are usually the busiest time of the year with silage and hay making and harvesting. Traditionally this farm had always kept sheep and corn so the change to beef cattle has been quite significant.
